org.forgerock.openam.core.rest.authn.callbackhandlers

Class RestAuthHttpCallbackHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.core.rest.authn.callbackhandlers.AbstractRestAuthCallbackHandler<HttpCallback>
      • org.forgerock.openam.core.rest.authn.callbackhandlers.RestAuthHttpCallbackHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JsonCallbackParser<HttpCallback>, RestAuthCallbackHandler<HttpCallback>

    public class RestAuthHttpCallbackHandler
extends AbstractRestAuthCallbackHandler<HttpCallback>
    Defines methods to update a HttpCallback from the headers and request of a Rest call and methods to convert a Callback to and from a JSON representation.

    • Method Detail

      • updateCallbackFromRequest

        public boolean updateCallbackFromRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                         HttpCallback callback)
                                  throws RestAuthResponseException
        Checks the request for the presence of a header with the Authorization Header as define in the HttpCallBack, if present and not an empty string then sets this on the Callback and returns true. Otherwise does nothing and returns false. Implemented here to provide the default behaviour of returning false if the request was made using GET. RestAuthCallbackHandlers can override if required but should not do so unless absolutely necessary. Uses the headers and request contents to update the Callback. If the Callback cannot be completed from the headers and request or the headers and request do not contain the required information the method MUST return false. This is for "zero page login" where the request contains all the required information to authenticate successfully. In this case no callbacks will be sent back to the client, only the success or failure of the authentication.
        Specified by:
        updateCallbackFromRequest in interface RestAuthCallbackHandler<HttpCallback>
        Overrides:
        updateCallbackFromRequest in class AbstractRestAuthCallbackHandler<HttpCallback>
        Parameters:
        request - The HttpServletRequest from the request.
        response - The HttpServletResponse for the request.
        callback - The Callback to update with its required values from the headers and request.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the Callback was successfully updated. client.
        Throws:
        RestAuthResponseException

      • handle

        public HttpCallback handle(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                           org.forgerock.json.JsonValue postBody,
                           HttpCallback originalCallback)
        Handles the processing of the JSON given in the request and updates the Callback objects from it. This is for special circumstances where the JSON from the request does not contain a "callback" attribute, where the handleJsonCallbacks() method should be used.
        Parameters:
        request - The HttpServletRequest from the request.
        response - The HttpServletResponse for the request.
        postBody - The POST body from the request.
        originalCallback - The original Callbacks to update.
        Returns:
        The updated originalCallbacks.

      • getCallbackClassName

        public String getCallbackClassName()
        Returns the class name of the Callback the implementation of this interface is for. Should only return the simple name of the class not the FQDN.
        Returns:
        The name of the class this parser is for.

      • convertToJson

        public org.forgerock.json.JsonValue convertToJson(HttpCallback callback,
                                                  int index)
                                           throws RestAuthException
        Converts the given Callback into JSON format. The JSON representation of the Callback MUST be in the following form:

        { type : "NameCallback", output : [ { name : "prompt", value : "Enter User Name:" } ], input : [ { key : "name", value : "" } ] }

        The type field MUST be the name of the Callback class. Output fields detail information that the client can use to display to the user. Input fields detail information that need to be complete before the callbacks is submitted.
        Parameters:
        callback - The Callback to convert to JSON.
        index - the position of this callback in the returned structure.
        Returns:
        The JSON representation of the Callback.
        Throws:
        RestAuthException

      • convertFromJson

        public HttpCallback convertFromJson(HttpCallback callback,
                                    org.forgerock.json.JsonValue jsonCallback)
                             throws RestAuthException
        Converts the JSONObject into a Callback, setting the values set in the JSONObject onto the given Callback. Method must set the appropriate values on the Callback parameter and return the same Callback parameter. This is required because of the way the AuthContext handles submitting requirements (Callbacks).
        Parameters:
        callback - The Callback to set values from the JSONObject onto.
        jsonCallback - The JSON representation of the Callback.
        Returns:
        The same Callback as in the parameters with the required values set.
        Throws:
        RestAuthException
